content.question: Two metal plates, <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, have equal masses and are at temperatures <math alttext="2 uppercase T sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="uppercase T sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>, respectively, when they are placed in thermal contact. Plate <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> has a specific heat that is twice that of Plate <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>. The temperature of each metal is recorded over time, and the temperatures of the plates are plotted in the graph as functions of time until the plates reach thermal equilibrium at time <math alttext="t sub equilibrium" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></math> at a temperature of <math alttext="five thirds uppercase T sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>. Which of the following statements is supported by the graph?

choices.label: The two-plate system is isolated from the surroundings.

More thermal energy is transferred into Plate <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math> than is transferred out of Plate <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>.

More thermal energy is transferred out of Plate <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> than is transferred into Plate <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>.
There is a net transfer of energy into the two-plate system.

content.answer: The two-plate system is isolated from the surroundings.
